overview: From 2026-01-01 to 2026-02-01, elizaos/eliza had 2 new PRs (2 merged), 20 new issues, and 6 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Public agent cards should have chat number
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body: Chat number is defined as total number of messages between the agent and all users

topIssues.title: Separate public agent states
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
There are three different states of interacting with public agents. They have fundamentally different user intents and should have a distinct UI. ## State 1: Unauthenticated Visitor (Not Signed In) **User Intent:** "I clicked a link on Twitter, I'm curious, let me try this agent" **What they should see:** * Clean chat interface focused on the agent * Agent avatar, name, @username, and brief bio/description * **No** Private/Public toggle * **No** Edit button * **No** Fork button (yet—they need to sign up first) * Copy shareable link button to share with others **Interaction model:** * Allow **2-3 free messages** before soft gate * After limit: "Sign up to continue chatting" overlay ## State 2: Authenticated Non-Owner (Signed In, Not Creator of Agent) **User Intent:** "I want to chat with this agent OR I want to make my own version" **What they should see:** * Chat interface * Agent info + creator attribution * **"Chat"** and **"Fork"** buttons (NOT Edit) * **No** Private/Public toggle * Clear indication this isn't their agent * Copy shareable link button to share with others ## State 3: Owner (Signed In, Is Creator) **User Intent:** "I want to manage/edit my agent" **What they should see:** * Full control UI * **Chat** and **Edit** tabs * **Private/Public toggle** with clear state indicator * Share button (when public) * Analytics/stats (future: views, chats, forks)

Current state for non-authenticated user when clicking on a public agent link.

topIssues.title: Limit messages for non-signed up user to ~2-3
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body: For users who are speaking with a public agent and are not signed in

topIssues.title: Chat summaries don't really make much sense. Can we improve
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body: Should be more like this

topPRs.title: fix(plugin-sql): use sql.raw() for SET LOCAL to avoid parameterizatio…
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body:
PostgreSQL SET commands do not support parameterized queries. The previous
implementation used Drizzle's sql tagged template which auto-parameterizes
values, causing "syntax error at or near $1" when ENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION=true.

- Change sql`SET LOCAL app.entity_id = ${entityId}` to sql.raw() with inline value
- Add unit tests for withEntityContext in manager.test.ts
- Add integration test to verify fix against real PostgreSQL

Fixes critical bug that broke all database operations with data isolation enabled.

topPRs.title: refactor(default-message-service): optimize provider handling in MultiStep
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body: # Risks Low. The change only affects the internal execution order of providers in multi-step mode. All providers still execute and return results - just faster. # Background ## What does this PR do? Converts sequential provider execution to parallel execution using `Promise.allSettled` in `runMultiStepCore`. This improves performance when multiple providers need to fetch data simultaneously. **Before:** Providers executed one after another (sequential) **After:** Providers execute in parallel with fault tolerance ## What kind of change is this? Improvements (misc. changes to existing features) # Documentation changes needed? My changes do not require a change to the project documentation. # Testing ## Where should a reviewer start? `packages/core/src/services/default-message-service.ts` - lines 1053-1107

topPRs.title: chore(license): update year to 2026
topPRs.author: rejected-l
topPRs.body:
Annual copyright year update. - Updated year: 2025 -> 2026 - Files affected: LICENSE

Greptile Summary

Updated the copyright year in the MIT License from 2025 to 2026. This is a standard annual maintenance update with no functional changes.

- This PR is completely safe to merge with zero risk - This is a trivial, single-line change updating only the copyright year in the LICENSE file - a standard annual maintenance task with no code changes, no dependencies affected, and no potential for runtime issues - No files require special attention
